snippet: Previously, money left at year-end in a tax-advantaged flexible spending arrangement was forfeited; now the government allows up to $500 to remain.
abstract: Ann Carrns Your Money Adviser column notes new federal rules will allow those with healthcare flexible spending accounts to roll over up to $500 in unspent funds to the next year; says some employees were wary of such accounts because unspent funds were forfeited at the end of the year.
lead_paragraph: Previously, money left at year-end in a tax-advantaged flexible spending arrangement was forfeited; now the government allows up to $500 to remain.

headline.main: New Rules Allow Carry-Over of Flexible Health Funds
headline.print_headline: New Rules Allow Carry-Over of Flexible Health Funds
